description: Composite number such that when sum of its prime factors is added or subtracted becomes prime.
comments: Prime factors counted with multiplicity, e.g., 44 = 2*2*11 so the sum of its prime factors is 15 (not 13).  From _Harvey P. Dale_, May 30 2012
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: spfQ[n_]:=Module[{s=Total[Times@@@FactorInteger[n]]},!PrimeQ[n] && PrimeQ[ n+s]&&PrimeQ[n-s]]; Select[Range[700],spfQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 30 2012 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Aug 15 1999.
